I finished my first placement at Byron Day Camp. Yeesh, what a group. We went and saw "Around the World in 80 Days". Great, I thought to myself. A busload of screaming kids, and then as we headed up to the movie, I exclaimed to my fellow LIT, "Great, first it was a bus full of screaming kids, now we can have a theatre full of them". My experience there was great though, I met some awesome people and had a wicked time. Well, I've been really busy lately, not really an excuse for not posting, but what the hell...

This week I am in the LIT program for the City of London Recreation and Neighboorhood Services program. LIT, you might ask? Lost in Translation for me, Leader in Training for everybody else. This is the first of two steps to becoming a qualified counciler for the City Daycamp programs! I have volunteered the past two years for the City of London and also the YMCA. My aim is to become a teacher when I am older, so hopefully this will help me accomplish this goal! Well, I haven't been on the net for about 2 days now. I have only been on for about 30 min/day. Scary for me. I just sorta ran out of things to do. Temporarly that is. Mike
